text: Masonry units (CMU/brick) as per approved submittals and specification
Units stored properly on level ground, protected from moisture
Mortar type and mix confirmed per specification
Reinforcement and ties (ladders, dowels, bars) per approved drawings
Layout verified per architectural and structural plans
First course set true, plumb, and level
Control and expansion joints located and detailed correctly
Weep holes and flashing installed at appropriate intervals
Bonding pattern consistent and as per drawings
Joint thickness uniform and as per tolerance (typically 3/8”)
Reinforcement placed correctly in cores, tied, and inspected prior to grouting
Grout mix, placement, and consolidation as per standard
Tooling of joints (concave, flush) per specification
Wall cleaned using approved methods without staining or damage
Work area protected from weather (cold/hot) during and after installation
Masonry protected from construction damage (rebar, rework, patching)
Final inspection completed and ready for following trade

id: • CSA A371 – Masonry Construction for Buildings
• CSA A179 – Mortar and Grout for Unit Masonry
